page.title: 17MR COOPER'S MEMORIES CONT.
page.content: The roads were made up periodically by a{steamroller}grinding flints into the mud with the water cart running on in front.Much of this forms the present foundation of the tarmacadam surface. There was a Blacksmith's Forge where Culverwells now is in New Town.Horses were reshod there and next door was the old hand pump used by the {fire brigade}.Three men each side operated it and the amusing part of the story is that the horse used by the coal merchant had to be commandeered.I can only presume the instructions must have been{'keep it {burning until we get there!'. As well as this there was a cattle market which was a real source of interest to us. I feel there is still a friendly, warm community spirit here.
